problem_text: (Well-known problem). Is it true that Golod p-groups are non-amenable? These infinite finitely generated torsion groups are defined in (E. S. Golod, Amer. Math. Soc. Transl. (2), 48 (1965), 103–106). P. de la Harpe
answer: Yes, moreover, such groups have infinite quotients with Kazhdan’s property (T) and are uniformly non-amenable (M. Ershov, A. Jaikin-Zapirain, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3), 102, no. 4 (2011), 599–636).
